video.title: What is Inflation?
video.description: The basics of what price inflation is and how the CPI-U is calculated.

problemSets.question: What is inflation? How does inflation affect individual consumers?

choices.answer: Inflation is the general increase in the prices of goods and services (i.e. things you purchase).
Inflation is the general decrease in the prices of goods and services (i.e. things you purchase).
Inflation affects your life by pressuring companies to increase prices of their products in order to maintain profitability.
Inflation affects your life by pressuring companies to increase prices of their products in order to maintain profitability.
A & C.
B & D.

problemSets.question: How does the Consumer Price Index (CPI) define a basket of goods and services?

choices.answer: A grouping of random items that consumers purchase even though they are non-essential.
A grouping of items that an average consumer needs to purchase.
A mixed grouping of random items and necessary items purchased by average consumers.

problemSets.question: What does the Consumer Price Index (CPI) measure?

choices.answer: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) measures inflation.
CPI measures the changes in purchasing power.
CPI measures changes in the average price of necessary goods and services purchased by average consumers.
All of the above.

problemSets.question: In _a a basket of goods and services is worth _x. In _b the equivalent basket is worth _y. Calculate the inflation (%) to express the decrease in purchasing power.
hint: \( Rate \: of \: Return \: = {{Value \: of \: later \: date \: - \: Value \: of \: earlier \: date } \over Value \: of \: earlier \: date} \)

problemSets.question: What is a difficulty faced when determining what belongs in the basket goods and services year-over-year?

choices.answer: Quickly evolving technologies, such as TV’s and smartphones, have significant price fluctuations. Once an item of that sort has been available for over a year, it’s treated as an outdated product and its price drops dramatically.
Inflation fluctuates differently for each good/service.
There are a lot of items certain people feel are necessary to purchase that are difficult to measure.
Different people purchase different things.

problemSets.question: Which of the following is used to measure inflation?

choices.answer: The Consumer Price Index (CPI), the indexed price of a basket of goods and services used by average Americans.
The Economist’s Big Mac Index, the price of a McDonald’s Big Mac in various cities around the world.
All of the U.S. stock market (AKA aggregate US stock market)
All of the above.
